chapter_title: INFECTION: AVOID THE UNHAPPY AND UNLUCKY
summary: In this chapter, Greene emphasizes the dangers of associating with the unhappy and unlucky, illustrating that emotional states are as infectious as diseases. He recounts the life of Lola Montez, whose allure and instability led men to their ruin, demonstrating how individuals with chronic dissatisfaction can draw others into their turmoil. The chapter warns that these 'infectors' can warp your reality and sap your strength, leading to personal and professional disasters. Instead, Greene advises seeking out the happy and fortunate, whose positivity can lift you. Ultimately, he reinforces that it is vital to quarantine oneself from those who threaten to spread misery.

slides.section_body: Just as diseases can spread, so too can emotional states. Surrounding yourself with the unhappy can drag you down into their despair, making you susceptible to their misery. Recognizing this can be the first step to protecting yourself. Seek companions whose spirits elevate your own.
slides.quote: You can die from someone else’s misery.

slides.section_body: Lola Montez’s life serves as a cautionary tale: her charm and chaos ensnared many men, leading them into their ruin. Her story highlights the atramentous pull of those who embody instability. One must remain vigilant to avoid falling under the enchantment of such characters.
slides.quote: Her power over them went beyond the sexual.

slides.section_body: Recognizing the signs of infectors is crucial: turbulent pasts, broken relationships, and an air of self-inflicted misery. Do not underestimate their ability to suck you into their vortex. Remain self-aware and cautious of those who project negativity.
slides.quote: Be forewarned by these signs of an infector.

slides.section_body: The only antidote to emotional infection is to quarantine yourself from those who drain your energy. Don't engage or attempt to fix them; this only leads to entanglement. Protect your own happiness fiercely and maintain healthy boundaries.
slides.quote: There is only one solution to infection: quarantine.

slides.section_body: Associating with the unfortunate can lead to guilt by association, damaging your own reputation. This risk far outweighs any desire to help. Be discerning in your relationships to avoid the pitfalls of misfortune.
slides.quote: You will waste valuable time and energy trying to free yourself.

slides.section_body: Conversely, associating with positive individuals can uplift you. Happiness and success are equally infectious. Seek out those who radiate joy and positivity, allowing their strengths to inspire and benefit you.
slides.quote: Associate with the happy and fortunate instead.

slides.section_body: Our emotions are shaped by those we spend time with. This principle of emotional osmosis posits that aligning yourself with the generous, cheerful, and successful can enhance your own well-being. Make a conscious effort to build affirming connections.

The infections from the unhappy can quietly erode your resolve and spirit. Guard yourself from those who siphon your vitality and drown your aspirations. Steer clear of persistent negative influences.
slides.quote: Never open your door to the least of misfortunes.

slides.section_body: Being proactive in your associations is essential. Evaluate the impact of those around you and act before it's too late. Trust your instincts about who brings joy and who spreads misery.
slides.quote: Learn to see the discontent in their eye.

slides.section_body: Ultimately, the quality of your companions significantly determines your life's trajectory. Choose wisely to cultivate a life filled with positivity and success. The fruits of such choices will inspire growth and happiness.
slides.quote: Infection is universal; avoid those who will infect you.
